title: 2 children killed in Kansas City shooting
content:
KANSAS CITY, Mo. —
Two boys were killed and a teen girl was injured in a shooting early Saturday morning in Kansas City police said.
An 8-year-old boy, a 9-year-old boy and a 16-year-old girl were shot just before 2 a.m. in the 5700 block of College Avenue. They were taken to a hospital, where the boys died.
"Very sad. No child should lose his life," said neighbor Vernon Trice. "And since I have two young boys myself, no child should lose their life."
The girl was expected to recover.
Police said the boys were cousins.
Kansas City Mayor Sly James said the gun violence in the city is an ongoing frustration. He said he believes many shootings could be prevented through a better focus on the problems of poverty and education.
"That is our fault, that is a shame on the leadership of this country, this state wherever, that we don't do what we know needs to be done," James said.
Anyone with information about the shooting is asked to call the TIPS Hotline at 816-474-8477.
